Reviews.Title: “Extended stay hotels for pricing”
Reviews.Author: emachine_12
Reviews.Content: We chose the extended stay on Black Canyon Highway (off of Peoria Ave) because we were visiting in Surprise Az and in Mesa Az and it was located in the Center. It could use updating but it has everything you need...great bed, handy kitchen, weekly cleaning, laundry, pool.

Reviews.Title: “Poop on the walls!”
Reviews.Author: AlaskaVixen
Reviews.Content: Absolutely horrible! Old dirty towels in the bathroom. Everything was dirty. The dishes, the bathroom, the furniture. It smelt horrible. It was unswept & un-vacuumed. I have never been in a more disgusting environment! The stairwell smelt like pee. The nasty hide-a-bed didn't even fit in the living room (my mother-in-law had to sleep on it as a love seat.) THERE WAS POOP SMEARED ON THE BATHROOM WALL! Left as fast as we could.

Reviews.Title: “serves its purpose well”
Reviews.Author: 2oldtravelers2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to St. Joesph's Hospital on W. Thomas Rd. and 7th. It is perfect for family members who are staying most of their day at the hospital. They have special rates for hospital stays. My husband's hospital stay was about 3 weeks. I was hesitant to stay there because of so many negative reviews. Either they have improved their service and accommodations, or the reviewers were given bad rooms, or expected a Hilton, Marriott, Sheraton experience at bargain rates... The room I stayed in was an efficiency apartment. You bring your own shampoo, food, and the rooms are only serviced once a week, which is fine. The staff were pleasant; weekday coffee, bagels, muffins, fruit are put out. The rooms are a bit shopworn, but the bed was comfortable, and the price is geared for practicality and long term, and not for vacations, luxury amenities. I would stay there again if another stay at the hospital was imminent. I

Reviews.Title: “Staff was nice and courtous great for the Money”
Reviews.Author: jvasqu11
Reviews.Content: Was here on bussiness for over a month and was treated great by the staff. Bathrooms were a bit dated but clean and the room itself was clean and also dated. Great place for extended stays. Please note that they do not change the bath towels and linens.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Johnathan796
Reviews.Content: The hallway smells like trash and my room was filthy. I was supposed to stay a second night but I couldn't get out of there fast enough. STAY AWAY.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sdfghasderthg
Reviews.Content: Worst Hotel ever, Had to wait an hour to checking because the front doors where locked for guest protection, no one at the front desk until 7am, room where very dirty and smelly, found syringes in the shower, used towels, looked like it has not been cleaned in a month. hard beds, light out. dirty pool. just all around bad!!!

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Astutefox
Reviews.Content: From the outside, the hotel looked great. The lobby was clean and the staff was courteous. Once we left the lobby, things went from good to bad! The hallway was dingy and the carpet was filthy-- we walked by several large stains that looked like dried blood or vomit. However, we wanted to check out the room before reaching any conclusions. Upon first blush the room looked okay. I could tell it's been recently remodeled-- fresh coat of paint, flat screen TV, refurbished cabinets. However, once I entered, I noticed: 1) The room was very worn: dirty carpet (cigarette burns and white stains), dented and chipped furniture; and stained sofa; 2) The bedsheets had hair and lipstick on it; 3) Someone's belonging were left in the closed (neatly bundled in a clear plastic bag); and 4) The room was infested with ROACHES! We grabbed our bags and left immediately. Extended Stay gave us a full refund with no apologies. We found a very clean and comfortable Holiday Inn Express for $30 more (breakfast included). SUMMARY The Good: Clean lobby; courteous staff. The Bad: Everything else, including: lobby that closes at 10pm; dirty hallways; dingy rooms; and ROACHES. Bottom line: Don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Hospital visit - economy prime - good value”
Reviews.Author: birchbaybill_9
Reviews.Content: On our way up from Yuma our power steering went out 40 mile short, so we staggered in. We were THRILLED the motel and our room were just across the lot from Firestone, who repaired our car (in one day). As we were there on a medical trip, we appreciated the "hospital discount" for our 3 days. Second night there, I left the windows down a bit and my cd's went away (classical, Hawaiian, and folk - figured they'd be tossed and checked trashes) - beware. Accommodation (queen studio) was perfectly adequate. Bed, fridge, TV, whaddayawant? Cont. breakfast minimal but adequate (take the bagel back to the room and toast it). Utensils skimpy (no dishes) but told if you ask, you get some. Staff friendly and helpful - ask for April. Deducted one star for loss of some of my favorite CD's.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for a no-frills business or personal trip”
Reviews.Author: jdraven
Reviews.Content: Pros: Really inexpesive for what you get, about a block away from metro rail, neighborhood is not bad/scary and was quiet, free and convenient/adequate parking, free continental breakfast, friendly and professional staff, clean Cons: Room is a bit small, the single is perfect for one person but even one more person would have been pushing it; AC system worked well but constantly required resetting for it to stay on; fixtures/electronics and decor was adequate and functional but dated, nothing but a treadmill in the rec room As other reviews have indicated, there is an unusual additional charge for maid service. But this apaprently only applies to stays longer than three night - I stayed just three nights and was NOT assessed this charge. Now, I didn't get any maid service, but neither did I find it necessary for such a short stay. My room included the things you would expect of an extended-stay hotel: dishwasher, range, microwave, dishtowels and basic kitchen utensils. This was way, way less expensive than other hotel options, and was a convenient location to just about anything in downtown Phoenix thanks to the metro rail (which I also give high marks). However, just be advised that it's no frills all the way. Then again , who would expect a luxury stay for these rates? It's somewhat better than adequte in every respect. For a short and inexpensive stay, it's great - I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great service!!”
Reviews.Author: UAZip13
Reviews.Content: This place was a great value for what you got. The room was large, especially for one person. The staff was friendly from check-in to during the week to check-out. I would definately stay there again. Slept very very good every night I was there, bed was comfy along w/ the pillows, cause pillows ultimately make it. DEFINATELY RECOMMEND!!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: dandesenberg
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to express my positive feelings about a recent stay at the Extended Stay America, Midtown in Phoenix...Because there was a rent-a-car shortage in the city, during my stay, I decided to stay at a place near the new Light Rail, and was happy to learn that this property was a about a block away from the train stop..(which takes you to downtown Phoenix, and on to points east like downtown Tempe)...Another convenient aspect was that it was walking distance to drug store, market, restaurants, coffee places, etc...(Great central location)...In relationship to the hotel property itself, I liked the decent size of the room, the kitchen...felt like a small studio apt...Also liked the breakfast area in the morning, & the pool area...Staff was friendly & helpful...I would definitely recommend this hotel to someone looking for a safe central Phoenix location close to the new Light Rail..

Reviews.Title: “Best feature is the metro”
Reviews.Author: Invernessian
Reviews.Content: There is little to criticize here, but little to praise either. The Queen Suite is rather cramped, the bathroom is in need of a refit and the facilities are basic. More positively, the excellent Metro tram system is only a block away, Safeways is 3 blocks, the price is reasonable and the neighbourhood is decent. Breakfast comprises coffee and bagels. The coffee is good, the bagels are OK. If you can get a bargain rate, this place is perfectly acceptable but I do not advise anybody to pay top dollar to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “not too terrible”
Reviews.Author: GilFennerty
Reviews.Content: stayed here for the superbowl in february of 2008. plenty of space. dual tvs was nice. sheets and room seemed clean enough. bathroom was pretty dirty. lock on our room door either didn't work, or was fiddled with by a would-be thief. we discovered this and reported it to the front desk, and apparently they took care of it because we were never robbed. there is absolutely nothing within walking distance. in a pinch (for example, if you get tickets to the super bowl on short notice) this place ain't so bad. but it ain't great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but iffy neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: maynard7
Reviews.Content: I got a room here via a bid for a 2-star hotel on Priceline (for downtown Phoenix area). I have mixed feelings about this hotel. The location is decent; near downtown Phoenix. I was assigned this hotel by Priceline. When I arrived, I asked the clerk for a room that would be quiet. She gave me a room next to housekeeping, and directly across the hall from the vending and laundry room. The air conditioner filters had never been cleaned, so I pulled them out and washed them in the bathtub. The mildew and mold in the air conditioner was so bad, though, that I changed to a different room the next day. The second room was better. Cars get broken into in the parking lot, as evidenced by broken car window glass on the ground, so don't leave anything of value in view when you park your car. They always clean up the glass before noon, so they know it happens all the time. I wouldn't say it's a bad neighborhood, but take precautions. The front desk staff doesn't seem to care much about anything. The hotel is quite attractive, and the rooms are nicely furnished. Even though this is an Extended Stay Deluxe, the rooms are smaller than the regular Extended Stay America hotels I've used in the past. They charge $4.99 per stay for wireless internet access, but the connection comes and goes depending on your room location. Before you pay the fee, wait and see if you can access a free network from your room, as my computer picked up other unsecured networks in the area with better connections.

Reviews.Title: “Not safe!!”
Reviews.Author: bosspigg
Reviews.Content: Extended Stay Deluxe on Osborn and 2nd Ave. My car got stolen! When I told the front desk attendant, he nonchalantly told me "oh yeah, another car got broken into that same night"! Several days later, I came out in the morning and 2 cars in the lot had their windows smashed in. The service is fine and the rooms are clean, but if it weren't for the fact that I have to stay here on business, I wouldn't touch this place with a 10-foot pole!
